citphrases.citphrase: whether having the effect or result, direct or indirect of reimbursing employees in respect of travel
whether amounts paid were "salary or wages" or "allowances" paid to the employees as such and thereby exempt from fringe benefits tax. taxation
whether allowance a living-away-from-home allowance benefit

whether it would be concluded allowance was compensation for additional expenses incurred by employee which if incurred by the employee would have been deductible under income tax assessment act 1936 . taxation
caravans or huts provided for accommodation of employees at work sites
whether if employee had to provide the accommodation himself the cost would have been deductible under income tax assessment act 1936
whether expenditure private or domestic expenditure.
